FuncDef:
The isis lsp seq-overflow auto-recover disable command prevents an IS-IS system from changing its system ID when it receives a locally generated LSP with the maximum sequence number (0xFFFFFFFF).
The undo isis lsp seq-overflow auto-recover disable command restores the default configuration. The isis lsp seq-overflow auto-recover disable command prevents an IS-IS system from changing its system ID when it receives a locally generated LSP with the maximum sequence number (0xFFFFFFFF). The undo isis lsp seq-overflow auto-recover disable command restores the default configuration. By default, an IS-IS system changes its system ID when it receives a locally generated LSP with the maximum sequence number.
CLIs: undo isis lsp seq-overflow auto-recover disable
